column1: 361,62,Enhanced Premium,Powerful Sales Presentation Skills,Organisational Development Concepts,enquiries@odctraining.com.sg,"In the age of ""Wow!"" marketing and advertising, it's important to make your presentation unique and audience focused.",27/10/14,28/10/14,,9am-5pm,NA,$642.00 / $545.70 (Cost inclusive of 7% GST),Singapore,"Enable learners to structure, script, and persuasively deliver sales presentations that will position them ahead of the competition",Key fundamentals about effective sales presentation,"Deliver an authentic, persuasive, and creative presentation",Key sales techniques for presenters to use in their sales presentations,"<div style=""text-align: justify;"">

column2: In the age of "Wow!" marketing and advertising, it's important to make your presentation unique and audience focused. Generic speeches and snazzy PowerPoint slides just don’t cut it anymore — especially with savvy corporate customers.

This 2-day workshop is specially designed for your Sales Consultants to enable them to structure, script, and persuasively deliver sales presentations that will position them ahead of the competition. At the end of the workshop, they will be able to deliver powerful, professional, polished presentations effectively.
- Communicate the benefits of your product or service in such a way that prospects or customers want your solution to their problem now.
-   Human Insight #1:   How people process information
-   Human Insight #2:   How we retain information
-   Customer research:  To understand what potential customers need, you have to understand the details of their business.
-   Getting to know the inner workings of a company, and its decision makers, is a crucial part of any effective sales pitch.
4.   Design a Presentation That Sings — Not Snoozes

column3: What do you want your audience to do?
What do you want your audience to know?
How do you want your audience to feel?

column2: Keeping these elements in mind will ensure that your message will be both listeners focused and           persuasive.
-    Determine the points you want to make, tailored to the specific customer.
-    Write out your goals for the meeting.
-    Take your insights into your customers’ needs and turn them into a story with a solid beginning, middle, and end.
-    Create the visual aids that best illustrate the story.
-    Eliminate jargon and confusing slides from the presentation.
6.   Deliver an authentic, persuasive, and creative presentation.
7.  Key sales techniques for presenters to use in their sales presentations
-   Create a connection between your product/service and the prospect.
-   How to effectively build rapport and trust
-   Questioning techniques to uncover needs and valuable information

column1: 391,62,Enhanced Premium,Finance for Non-Finance Managers,Organisational Development Concepts,enquiries@odctraining.com.sg,Discover how to raise financial awareness of non-financial employees and use financial information to mak effective business decisions,5/3/2015,6/3/2015,,9am-5pm,NA,$642.00 / $545.70 (Cost inclusive of 7% GST),Singapore,"Learn to apply the fundamentals of finance to improve budget management, increase potential profits, assess the financial viability of projects and ultimately, enhance shareholders‰Ûª value.",See the big picture: What makes a business successful,Understand & Analysis the annual reports: What to make out of financial informat,Design the course of action: What can be done to improve the business,"From Financial Awareness to Business Effectiveness
Discover How to Raise Financial Awareness of Non-Financial Employees and use Financial Information to Make Effective Business Decisions!

With increasing emphasis on corporate governance and enhancing shareholders’ funds of companies, financial awareness for Managers is not an option, but a necessity, and a requirement. There is a greater need for managers at all levels to require financial knowledge to communicate with financial specialists and understand the financial impacts of their operational decisions.

This course transforms financial and accounting concepts into decision-making tools that can be used successfully every day. Participants will learn to apply the fundamentals of finance to improve budget management, increase potential profits, assess the financial viability of projects and ultimately, enhance shareholders’ value.
By attending this workshop, participants will:
See the big picture: What makes a business successful

column3: Understand the principles of business success, expectations of shareholders and their views of risk and the importance of corporate governance.

column1: Understand the reporting: What have been achieved thus far

column3: Be equipped with skills to understand financial statements and be able to evaluate the financial performance and health of a business, such as

column1: - Components of Cost of goods sold

column3: Appreciate the key underlying accounting concepts used in the preparation of financial statements especially the application of revenue recognition and accrual concepts.

column1: Analyse the annual reports: What to make out of financial information

column3: Know how to interpret financial statements and analyse businesses strengths and weaknesses using ratio analysis

column1: Design the course of action: What can be done to improve the business
- Gain knowledge of credit management and understands the impact of working capital management on cash flow;
- Understand the relationship between sales and margins and the impact on profitability when price changes;

- Know the different categories of costs which exist and their implication on costing. Understand and perform breakeven analysis and calculate margin of safety ratio and be able to consider relevant costs in making short-term tactical decisions; and
- Understand and apply the payback and net present value methods of project appraisal in decision making.
Lectures, discussions, exercises and case-studies, using financial statements of real world companies
** Participants are required to bring along their calculators for the course.

393,62,Enhanced Premium,Effective Skills for a Winning Presentation,Organisational Development Concepts,enquiries@odctraining.com.sg,Public speaking is a set of skills not a talent. You can be a good presenter if you learn the skills for presentation success.,8/1/2015,9/1/2015,,9am-5pm,NA,$642.00 / $545.70 (Cost inclusive of 7% GST),Singapore,Master the skills for presentation and build the confidence that will make you a better speaker and presenter.,Plan and prepare presentation,Create a professional presence,Deliver presentation with skill and confidence,"<div style=""text-align: justify;"">

column2: A great presentation does not just happen. It is planned, rehearsed then delivered with flair. A good presenter is one who learns the skills of presentations - not one who hopes for talent to carry them.

Public speaking is a set of skills not a talent. You can be a good presenter if you learn the skills for presentation success. Great presenters start as poor speakers – then they get better. A great presenter has two unique qualities: appropriate skills and personal confidence. This confidence comes from knowing what you want to say and being comfortable with your communication skills. In this two day workshop, participants will master the skills and build the confidence that will make them a better speaker and presenter.
This workshop will help you teach participants how to:
• Recognize how visual aids can create impact and attention

column3: How many can you relate to.
Human Insight #2: How we retain information
Root cause of fear of public speaking.
Techniques to overcome nervousness and fear.

- Relate opening to the central theme.

It is important to understand and apply writing effectively in all correspondence to capture the attention of our readers.  In this course you will learn to employ writing techniques to communicate effectively, for results.
After the course, participants should be able to:

Writing skills/Styles to project positive corporate image
Use of the word, the phrase, the sentence & paragraph

column1: 401,62,Enhanced Premium,Competency Based Interview and Selection Techniques,Organisational Development Concepts,enquiries@odctraining.com.sg,"Companies are fighting to hire talents. How do you select the right candidates with the knowledge, skill and attitude that the company is looking for?",20/11/14,21/11/14,,9am-5pm,NA,$642.00 / $545.70 (Cost inclusive of 7% GST),Singapore,To be equipped with the competency based interviewing technique,Discover the importance of effective interviewing,Prepare and conduct interviews that are able to generate candidate's information,Learn and apply behavioral interviewing techniques,"<div style=""text-align: justify;"">

column2: The war for talents has been waging for years. There are no signs of ceasefire but rather in certain sectors and industries, the tension is far from over. So what now that you have candidates waiting to be interviewed by you and because of the talent war you select whoever that knocks on your door? It is an all-time dilemma.

Jim Collins in his book,” Good to Great” used a great analogy of getting up a bus to exemplify the importance of hiring. His research suggested that great companies first decide who then what. That means that the quality of the hire is more important that what you want the candidate to do (job description is baseline). Usually with quality hire, they can definitely perform more than expected and beyond the job description. With wrong hire, it will cost at least 9 months of loss productivity and other associated costs.
Hire right is important but how?

Competency based interview skills workshop is the recommended solution for you. In this workshop, you will be expected to define what drives performance and how to achieve performance which is commonly known as competencies and you will be taught how to craft questions around competencies; set an interview framework around the questions and peppered with lots of practices. Also it helps to address a common mistake that most hiring managers’ commit which is to hire based on experience.

Whether you are new in hiring or experienced hiring manager, this 2-day training workshop is designed for you.  If you are exhausted using yester-years approaches, be refreshed with competency based interview skills workshop.

column3: Discover the importance of effective interviewing
Prepare and conduct hiring interviews that are effective in generating information about candidate’s prior performance and skills and enable the selection of the best person for the job
Learn and apply behavioral interviewing techniques
Practice the interviewing technique with a complete interviewing process

column2: The workshop is design to equip participants with practical skills for interviewing and selection and learning is centred around interactive, activity-based, experiential and accelerated learning. Participants will be fully engaged for optimal learning and maximum results.

column1: 420,62,Enhanced Premium,Effective Negotiation & Persuasion Skills,Organisational Development Concepts,enquiries@odctraining.com.sg,The importance of successful negotiation cannot be overstated in a competitive business world. Possessing negotiation skills is essential in getting results.,4/12/2014,5/12/2014,,9am-5pm,NA,$642.00 / $545.70 (Cost inclusive of 7% GST),Singapore,To be equipped with practical negotiation skills to gain business edge and help build longer term results,Use effective strategies to negotiate,Adopt the right interpersonal skills and attitude during negotiation,Persuade and influence to achieve business results,"<div style=""text-align: justify;"">

column2: In today’s business climate, the importance of successful negotiation cannot be overstated. Organization negotiates every day; equipping your team with practical negotiation skills gives them the edge as well as helps them build longer term results. Effective negotiators are not born ? they can be made ? and this workshop is designed to jump start a participant firmly on the road to mastery for effective negotiation and persuasion skills.
At the end of the workshop, participants will be able to:

column3: Adopt the right interpersonal skills and attitude during negotiation
Persuade and influence to achieve business results
A framework for the negotiation process
The difference between position and interest negotiation
Planning and Preparation – getting the facts and setting the objectives
A study of human nature and behavior as a foundation for Persuasion and Influencing skills
Mental Triggers (Also known as Laws of Persuasion)

column2: The Workshop will be activity-based and interactive with experiential and accelerated learning. Activities, videos, case studies and role plays will be used to bring across pertinent learning points. Participants will be fully engaged for optimal learning and maximum results.

It is important to understand and apply writing effectively in all correspondence to capture the attention of our readers.  In this 2-day workshop, you will learn to employ writing techniques to communicate effectively, for results.
OVERVIEW OF CREATIVE THINKING FOR INNOVATIVE PROBLEM SOLVING

Creative Thinking is a vital skill set where employees with the ability to “think outside of the box”, can help organisations save millions of dollars through creative problem solving and process improvement. Although not all employees possess the “creative flair”, there are proven methodology which they can learn to aid themselves to start thinking creatively.

This 2-day workshop will provide the participants with an insight to the world of creative thinking by imparting to the learners, tools and techniques that they can apply to aid themselves overcome the barriers of creative thinking.

Partners in Leadership is the premier provider of Leadership and Workplace Accountability Training services. Their comprehensive research shows that a lack of personal accountability for achieving organizational results is a common organizational challenge. The Self Track Training™ is based on the Oz Principle®. It provides a proven and powerful methodology for helping people at every level of the organization take greater personal accountability for overcoming the obstacles they face and asking "What else can I do?" to achieve key organizational results.
• Clarify Key Organizational Results, align people's daily work objectives with those results.
• Introduce a positive approach to creating greater accountability throughout the organization.
• Create greater ownership for achieving Key Results by using the Steps to Accountability.
• Learn how to apply tools and practices to accelerate greater accountability, individually and organizationally.
• Develop specific action steps using Accountability Plans for Creating A Culture Of Accountability and achieving the desired results.

Anyone accountable to delivering key results and key initiatives for a team and business including Executives, Team and Project Leaders working across teams, Management, Senior Management and Directors of Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) as well as Multinational Corporations (MNCs)

In addition to the Oz Principle Accountability Training workbook and tools, participants will also receive a the New York Times bestselling book, The Oz Principle (softback). Included is the 45-day subscription to PILtools - the online training and retention tool.

Henry Lee and Alex Butt are the Managing Partners of Glides Consulting Partners and are the Certified Facilitators for this Accountability Training. Alex and Henry have a combined span of 49 years of corporate experience. For detailed profiles, go to http://glidespartners.com/about-us/our-people/

Email lizk@glidespartners.com with the following details: Full name*, Contact* and Email*, Country*, Organization, Designation. Email info@glidespartners.com for enquiries or call Elizabeth Khong at +5 97849579.

column4: Upon completion of the course, eligible participants will be assessed on required Competency Units (CUs). For each CU passed, participants will be issued a Statement of Attainment

column1: 432,75,Enhanced Premium,WSQ Strategic Design Thinking,"Institute of Systems Science, National University of Singapore",isstraining@nus.edu.sg,This course has been designed for Senior Managers looking to introduce innovation and understand Design Thinking within their organisation.,27/11/14,28/11/14,,9am to 5pm,WSQ,"S$513.60* (Singaporeans/PRs), S$1712 (International)",Singapore,All of the core stages of the design thinking process will be covered:,Understand ‰ÛÒ user research and ethnographic approaches to research,"Explore ‰ÛÒ ideation, journey mapping, experience mapping",Test and Refine - blueprinting,"<div>

column3: At the end of the course, you will be able to:

column4: To appreciate the Strategic Application of Design Thinking
To understand the strategic intent and landscape of the organisation relating to innovation
To develop insights about problems, unmet needs and organisational landscape using ethnography and similar methods such as journey mapping
Understand how to use research data in a design and innovation orientated way
Understand that innovation is about delivery and appropriate strategies for bringing that about
Understand and select appropriate innovation models

column3: This course is intended for senior managers and leaders within organisations, or those progressing into these positions.

First hand experience of the METALOGå¨ tools and training methods and explore how to apply the tools in your own training workshops.,29/10/14,30/10/14,,0830-1700,Jointly issued by Metalog Training Academy Germany and 3iQ Leadership.,"SGD$1688 for organisations, less 60% IRAS PIC Credit where applicable. SGD$500 for Freelance Trainer",Singapore,"Your workshops and training sessions will be more impactful, high energy, and effective as participants learn through their experience and reflection guided by you.",Plan your Team Workshops for Impact,Enable your participants to learn from experience,Experience a wide range of Training Tools,"

METALOG® training tools are multifaceted interaction activities and learning projects for indoor (and outdoor) use. Their simplicity and powerful effect are engaging and fun, engage all of the learner’s senses allowing participants to really experience learning topics such as communication, leadership, team dynamics and roles, and many other common learning topics.
Day 1: TeamNavigator, Tower of Power, SysTEAM, Pipeline, The Band, CommuniCards, Team2, Leonardo’s Bridge, EmotionCards.
Day 2: Scoop, The Maze, Communic8, LoonyLoop, Magic Nails, The Philosopher’s Stone, Gordian Poles, RealityCheck, CultuRallye, Complexity, FacilitationBalls.

Team development, building trust, leadership communication, Project management, communication interfaces, Feedback, Self organisation, systemic coaching (coaching the person and group as a system), Distribution of work, quality of work, Team and work Interdependency, playful activation.
